newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Fortis AG loses 5 pct on profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Fortis AG loses 5 pct on profit-taking.

text.p: Shares in Belgian insurance group Fortis AG fell five percent on Tuesday as market players dumped the share amidst worries that a major downturn had begun after the Dow's .DJI correction.
Traders said shares, such as Fortis, which had seen recent bull runs would be hardest hit by market nervousness as fears over further U.S. interest rate hikes intensify.
By 1120 GMT Fortis AG was down 4.88 percent at 5,850 francs, with 280 million Belgian francs volume of the share traded.
Fortis AG is the Belgian parent of Belgian-Dutch banking and insurance group Fortis.
The Dutch partner is Fortis AMEV. AMEV shares were also down around six percent.
-- Paul de Bendern, Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6815, Fax +32 2 230 7710
